perturbation.original_text: 2.7 "Sponsorship Rights" means the bundle of rights, services and deliverables Allied will provide to Newegg as set out in Schedule 4, which includes the license of, and rights with respect to, Allied Marks granted in Section 5.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.7 "Sponsorship Rights" means the bundle of rights, services and deliverables Allied will provide to Newegg, which includes the license of, and rights with respect to, Allied Marks granted in Section 5.
perturbation.explanation: By removing "as set out in Schedule 4" it becomes unclear what the Sponsorship Rights are comprised of, creating potential ambiguity. This is further complicated because other sections still reference Schedule 4.

perturbation.original_text: 8. Refund or Reduction of Sponsorship Fee 8.1 Without limitation of other rights of Newegg under this Agreement, the Parties agree to negotiate a reasonable reduction and, where applicable, the refund of the Sponsorship Fee to reflect any material restriction in the benefit or value of the Sponsorship Rights to Newegg, including as a result of any change in any laws or regulatory provisions which has an adverse impact on the value of the Sponsorship Rights. 8.2 If Allied fails to perform or provide the Sponsorship Rights in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, Newegg shall, without limiting its other rights or remedies, have one or more of the following rights: (a) to refuse to accept any subsequent performance of the Sponsorship Rights which Allied attempts to make; and (b) where Newegg has paid in advance for Sponsorship Rights that have not been provided by Allied, to have such sums refunded by Allied.
perturbation.changed_text: 8. Refund or Reduction of Sponsorship Fee 8.1 Without limitation of other rights of Newegg under this Agreement, the Parties agree to negotiate a reasonable reduction and, where applicable, the refund of the Sponsorship Fee to reflect any material restriction in the benefit or value of the Sponsorship Rights to Newegg. 8.2 If Allied fails to perform or provide in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, Newegg shall, without limiting its other rights or remedies, have one or more of the following rights: (a) to refuse to accept any subsequent performance which Allied attempts to make; and (b) where Newegg has paid in advance, to have such sums refunded by Allied.
perturbation.explanation: By removing "including as a result of any change in any laws or regulatory provisions which has an adverse impact on the value of the Sponsorship Rights" from 8.1 and "the Sponsorship Rights" from 8.2, the circumstances triggering a refund/reduction are now less clear and the actions that result in a refund/performance refusal are not clearly tied to the Sponsorship Rights as previously defined.

perturbation.original_text: 2.6 "Sponsorship Benefits" means the benefits Newegg will provide Allied, including the license granted in Section 6.1 and the fee stated in Schedule 3. 2.10 "Sponsorship Fee" has the meaning given in Schedule 3 of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.6 "Sponsorship Benefits" means the benefits Newegg will provide Allied, including the license granted in Section 6.1. 2.10 "Sponsorship Fee" has the meaning given elsewhere in this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the reference to Schedule 3 in both 2.6 and 2.10, and replacing the specific location of the definition of Sponsorship Fee to a vague definition creates a problem in enforcing this agreement. The term is mentioned elsewhere but the actual definition is unclear.
